metadata.title: USN-5272-1 -- HDF5 vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that HDF5 incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5272-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libhdf5-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 libhdf5-doc - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 libhdf5-dev - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 libhdf5-cpp-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 libhdf5-jni - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 hdf5-helpers - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 libhdf5-java - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 libhdf5-mpich-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 libhdf5-mpi-dev - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 libhdf5-openmpi-103 - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 libhdf5-mpich-dev - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 libhdf5-openmpi-dev - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 hdf5-tools - 1.10.4+repack-11ubuntu1+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
